Html:
Zach,

What was the rational behind deleting the locations?

"1) Deleted Locations. We MIGHT put it back in for beta 2... but it is OUT for beta 1"

It is a very integral part of the CSK.
I agree, I use Locations for directions and local information and have put a lot of work in adding my locations, needs to be back in before I upgrade

SubSonic 2.0.2 doesn't support "JOINS" so I was just going to simplify it for beta 1. It will most likely be put back in for beta 2. I need to work out the "join" query with SubSonic, first.

Unless this is an absolute necessity....?

It is a necessity. It is how many club sites provide location information and directions to the Events. Taking this out is a major step in the wrong direction. We should focus on enhancing the kit not removing modules.

I'm surprised subsonic doesn't support multi table selects.

Is it just the "join" syntax it has issues with? Can you just use where table1.id = t2.id type logic?
I don't think there is a way to write a SubSonic query with 2 tables in mind.

Looks like you're right:
http://actionpack.wekeroad.com/forums/t/1330.aspx

That seems incredibly limiting. Hopefully they'll remedy that fairly quickly.

I will file a feature request with them. I do know that they will be starting on a new query engine. I will suggest that better JOIN support be added then.

I could do it with an SP... but I like doing it by code MUCH better.

(Hey Tina... are you interested in becoming a dev on this project???? You have contributed in the forums lately and I think it has proven that you know your stuff!)

OK... I put in a Feature Request over at the SubSonic issue tracker. GO VOTE FOR IT! The faster they implament a "Join" feature, the faster we can get location put back in!

http://www.codeplex.com/actionpack/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=11739

Any updates on this? The loss of this feature has gad a significant impact on my ability to upgrade my site to 3.X.

What is Subsonic saying?
